name: Black-eyed Pea Pizza crust, Blackberry Tomato chutney w/ Cauliflower, and Spinach Blackberry Mint Salad. Glutenfree, recipe
description: Award winning pizza! Fully vegan with a black-eyed pea pizza crust
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups black eyed peas (canned, cooked or sprouted)
1/2 cup chopped Collard greens or other greens
1-2 Tablespoon melted 70% cacao chocolate (skip if you dont like the chocolatey bitterness)
2 Tablespoons organic oil of choice (I used 1 Tbsp virgin coconut and 1 Tbp extra virgin olive oil)
1/2 teaspoon garam masala or to taste
1  dried red chili or to taste or skip
1 Tablespoon 70% cacao chocolate or any bittersweet chocolate

recipeInstructions.text: Start up the oven to preheat to 425 degrees F.
recipeInstructions.name: Start up the oven to preheat to 425 degrees F.

recipeInstructions.text: Pulse all ingredients for the crust until a thick doughy batter is formed. Use a Tablespoon or so water if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Pulse all ingredients for the crust until a thick doughy batter is formed. Use a Tablespoon or so water if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the thick batter on parchment lined sheet using circular motion to about a 1/4 inch thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the thick batter on parchment lined sheet using circular motion to about a 1/4 inch thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, make the Chutney sauce. In a pan, add oil, heat on medium high.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, make the Chutney sauce. In a pan, add oil, heat on medium high.

recipeInstructions.text: Add ginger and chili, Mix for a few seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add ginger and chili, Mix for a few seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chopped tomato and blackberries, salt to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chopped tomato and blackberries, salt to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook for 3 minutes. Stir every few seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook for 3 minutes. Stir every few seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cauliflower, toss and cover and cook till 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cauliflower, toss and cover and cook till 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the crust out. Top it with the cauliflower and the thick chutney.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the crust out. Top it with the cauliflower and the thick chutney.

recipeInstructions.text: Add halved grape tomatoes and other veggies of choice.
recipeInstructions.name: Add halved grape tomatoes and other veggies of choice.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 20-25 minutes. Garnish with freshly chopped mint and chili flakes before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 20-25 minutes. Garnish with freshly chopped mint and chili flakes before serving.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, prep the salad. Chop up greens(I used Spinach), add Blackberries and mint.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, prep the salad. Chop up greens(I used Spinach), add Blackberries and mint.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small pan, heat the balsamic vinegar on low. As soon as it starts to bubble a little, take off heat.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small pan, heat the balsamic vinegar on low. As soon as it starts to bubble a little, take off heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Let this mix cool for a few seconds and then top the salad with the dressing.
recipeInstructions.name: Let this mix cool for a few seconds and then top the salad with the dressing.

recipeInstructions.text: If you like the dressing, then sprinkle some on the pizza as well!:) Serve.
recipeInstructions.name: If you like the dressing, then sprinkle some on the pizza as well!:) Serve.

keywords: glutenfree pizza crust, vegan pizza crust
